cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. May 1942.SECRET.W.M. (42)60th Conclusions.Copy No.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may he taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 60 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Sunday, May 10, 1942, at 6 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P.,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The-Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.O, M.P., Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The following were also present:The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,. M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.General Sir Alan Brooke, Chief of theImperial General Staff.The Right Hon. Sir James Grigg,M.P., Secretary of State for War.Admiral of the Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.Air Chief Marshal Sir WilfredFreeman, Vice-Chief of the AirStaff.Vice-Admiral Lord Louis - Mount-batten, Chief of Combined Opera-tions.Secretariat:Sir Edward Bridges.Major-General Sir Hastings Ismay.future operations.(previous reference erence:W.M. (42) 59thConclusions.)The War Cabinet had a discussion on operational matters,which is recorded in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet conclusions.Great George Street. S.W. 1,May 10, 1942.
